overview_of_class: Speaking clearly and comfortably in public is a valuable and often essential skill to possess. This course prepares students for a variety of professional, academic, and social situations in which formal presentations are required. Students will learn how to research, outline, and deliver short, informal presentations as well as longer speeches. This course will give students the opportunity to develop and strengthen skills in preparing and presenting public oral presentations in a variety of situations. It should also sharpen students' skills in critical listening. Although theoretical foundations for the methods taught will be included, this is a practice-oriented course.
name: Public Speaking & Presentation Skills
title: DOHA GEN_CMN 102-0-70 Public Speaking & Presentation Skills
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Registration is reserved for sophomore, juniors, and seniors only.
